Title: Anyone who gives this film higher than a 9 lacks integrity, or just has never seen a good movie
Review Text: A lot of the late dictator's loyalists will hype this film up but its really, really boring. It's not the worst film I've seen but just like most of Darryl Yap's films, it's trash. Much of the acting from Christine Reyes is just her shouting. It's a grating noise to the ears. The maids in the film are the best part of it as the delivery of their lines are somewhat entertaining, however the lines and "hugots" feel so forced and shallow. The main problem is really the script. The emotional scenes feel so forced. It's obviously a propaganda film and a really boring one at that. It had an okay start but dragged so much at the middle almost as if they were trying to fit a bunch of propaganda from a checklist. The soundtrack and cinematography are okay but not enough to salvage the film. Skip it.

Title: PUTANGINA
Review Text:
I don't know why people review this movie with 1 star, The movie have good combination of comedy and drama, But I think need more cinematography.

Overall the movie is good to watch and not boring but need more improvement.

Title: It's okay.
Review Text: Entertaining but confusing. Chapters are not connected with each other. It felt like broken and scattered. It felt like something made by an amateur. Great idea, poor execution, great acting tho!

Title: Ferdinand E Marcos Sr is a great president
Review Text: This movie shows a president who loves his people. I don't call him a dictator. I call him a great president. The Marcos family became victim of many false accuses.. I'm happy they are back.

Title: Another Darryl Yap trademark
Review Text: Political messages aside, the movie editing is messy and incoherent at times. The scene transitions were bad even for a typical Filipino drama. The acting seems forced and the story direction tries too hard but fails to convince viewers to sympathize with the cast because of badly placed comedic banters in between scenes and badly-written script. It seems like the director didn't learn or even try to improve on his filmmaking formula which has already been frowned upon in his previous films.

Title: Not even worth it
Review Text:
Honestly, I was expecting a coherent turn of events in this film. However, the lack of cinematography bores me to the point it feels like I'm watching a poorly executed youtube skit. As to the transition of the scenes, it was choppy. At first, I thought I'll get used to it but it turns out to be very unnecessary and annoying. The color grading was ok but I supposed they could have done more in terms of the lighting.

Furthermore, the acting was so bland and god it was horrible, in fact one of the actress could not shed a tear in the climax of the film. Nonetheless, the girl with the short hair expresses well with her eyes but her voice screeches sometimes. The dialogues written was plain and bland unfortunately did not engaged us viewers. I was hoping they would take us back to that time but that was not the experience at all.

Overall, the movie felt so rush and unproduced. Not even worth your time.

Title: SO IMPRESSIVE
Review Text: I love the movie! It shows about what happened in the last days of Marcoses in Palace. I've learned a lot. Thank you for creating this awesome political movie!

Title: It made me cry
Review Text:
Please ignore harsh and negative comments about this movie. Most of them only watched the trailer and never bothered to watch the whole film. They are primarily from people who hate the Marcos family.

I just watched it last night, and it made me cry. I never expected myself to cry over a biopic, semi-documentary film that depicts the last 72 hours of the family of the leader who has been tagged as a dictator in Philippine history.

I don't have much expectation when it comes to local Filipino films. I never bother watching one in the past. But, for this one, I made an exemption.

I have watched maybe a thousand movies and foreign tv series; thus, I have a very high standard when rating one.

For this film, I rate it 6.5 stars.

It's a low-budget movie with a very compelling storyline and dialogue, and I don't want it to end. When it ended, I felt like there were more stories to tell, thus the reason I gave it a 6.5-star rating.

Another reason for my rating is that a few scenes are OA. I hope the director can improve his craft in the sequel movie, MoM - Martyr or Murderer? I am very interested to know what the Marcos family's take about the assassination of Benigno Aquino.

Title: It could've been better.
Review Text:
I know criticism is your enemy, but let's be honest in here.

Apparently, this could've been a good movie if all of these plots and stories were made with true and validated proofs. I could say it's not "bad" to tell the story of the Marcoses-if only they were truthful to what the Marcoses did back-in their last 72-hours in Malacañang. I could say that most of the plot in this movie is just as distorted as ever, although I wanted to hear a single thing that Marcos Sr. Admits his mistakes that he have done to his country back then, but it turns out that this movie came out to be such an anti-climatic, and distorted. I know this is hard to accept, but mocking the Carmelite Sisters playing Mah-Jhong, making Cory falsely say "Let them out of the Philippines" isn't really the most accurate stuff I've ever seen in the movie. There are still missing pieces that I wanted to hear from this movie's script and plot.

I could re-watch it again to re-validate the topics above, but no, Daryl Yap, you should've grabbed the history books and read them well-even if it contains your enemies' stories, learn to accept them-accept the truth for everyone to accept your movie, and not keeping up with those beautiful lies to distort the lads.

Title: I TRIED
Review Text: Watched this on the first day of release and was in utter disappointment on how bad the whole film was. Setting the fact that the goal of this film was to distort history, the overall production of the film was bad and mediocre. Some actors stood out with their good performances but clearly wasn't enough to save the whole film. Dialogues are weak and bland. There are no remarkable scenes and yes it's safe to say that I wasted my time watching this but hey...I tried.

Title: Stereotype movie
Review Text: Not worth watching, acting was poor, cinematics are too bland. For a movie that is overly hyped, this movie looks really cheap. I've watched better indie films than this.

Title: The title says it all: a version of a tale of one of the most contentious times in modern Philippine history...
Review Text:
The title says it all: a version of a tale of one of the most contentious times in modern Philippine history as told from the point of view of three domestic helpers employed in the dictator: Ferdinand Marcos Senior's Presidential Palace.

(This is obviously the root of a recent trending topic on Philippine social media pitting historical accuracy against rumor-mongering - with the clear intent to validate this film's point of view.)

With the involvement in this film's production of a lone, single, individual with the last name 'Marcos,' from the entirety of this point in Philippine history; the film is the embodiment of a lone, single, individual's point of view.

Full transparency: this reviewer could only stand the first 30 minutes of the film before storming out because almost all of the events are conveyed through the incessant shouted narration, screamed narration, and complained narration of three fictional maids.

Context was totally absent - leaving the viewer to figure out for themselves and navigate the precise point in history that is being portrayed on film. As a witness to this history, even I could not make heads or tails of it.

Adding to the confusion, the actors playing their respective roles did not even exert any effort to try to emulate the mannerisms, speech patterns, and idiosyncrasies of the historical characters they are portraying. It's a guessing game, distracting from whatever message the film tries to convey, unless the entire nature of this film's existence is to distract.

The constant cutting between re-enactments and historical footage adds to the confusion since no attempt was made to recreate the footage using the actors in the same context. Go figure!

This is bad. Really bad. Really, really bad. If you're a masochist wishing and willing to undergo being constantly screamed at by the help, then, by all means, waste your hard-earned money.

Title: Darryl Yap is a genius!
Review Text: After 30+ years, Filipinos were able to hear and understand the other side of the story. Kudos to all cast from Apo Lakay to all helpers in the palace! They're all amazing! I underestimated Ella Cruz but she's a really good actress! I wish the movie had more scenes with Irene Marcos. I also love Christine Reyes! More Marcos movies soon, Direk!

Title: history revisionism
Review Text:
Maid in Malacañang (2022) Directed by: Darryl Yap

Huling tatlong araw ng mga Marcos sa Malacañang... Ano ang nangyari ?

The movie didn't give the experience of a family in their last 72 hours.

The progression of events is anti-climactic.

The flow of conversation is dull.

The choice of words is hollow.

The storytelling is not cohesive.

It feels like you're watching some YouTube skits, TV Patrol excerpts, Theater scenes and SOCO rolled into one.

News. Drama. Documentary.

Fiction. Biopic. Comedy.

Fantasy. Tribute. History.

They didn't know what to tell and how to tell it, so they showed a bit of every other thing.

They just combined all their scenes by inserting "chapters" and "long texts" in between that literally summarizes what they want to tell-which defeats the purpose of a movie.

Some scenes give the impression of one long continuous shot. It actually works when Cristine Reyes is in the scene.

Si Cristine Reyes ang nagdala ng pelikula. Tumataas ang tensyon kapag siya na ang nasa eksena.

Magaling umiyak si Ella Cruz. Masaya ang tambalan nila Karla Estrada, Elizabeth Oropesa at Beverly Salviejo.

Walang dating si Cesar Montano.

Walang emosyon si Diego Loyzaga.

Walang ginawa sina Kiko Estrada at Kyle Velino.

Mas malakas ang prisensya nina Robin Padilla at Giselle Sanchez kahit ilang segundo lang sila nagpakita.

Hindi marunong umarte si Ruffa Gutierrez. Lumuluha na pero mukhang nagpapatawa pa rin.

Mas magaling pa umarte yung bodyguard na taga-Ilocos daw.

Meron mga salita na hindi naman ginagamit nuon. Pero lantaran nilang sinasabi sa pelikulang ito.

The scoring is deceiving, trying to enhance the scene-even when there's nothing remarkable in it.

Then by the end, there's a sudden tribute to characters that were not given its decent exposure during the actual movie runtime. An illusion that something is made for them-when it is not.

Mapanlinlang ang pelikula.

Makalat ang kabuuan.

Pero hinding hindi ka makakatulog.

Gising ka sa lahat ng kaganapan.

Katulong ka sa paghubog ng kasaysayan.

Title: Brilliant Movie with sense of humor!
Review Text:
This side of the story had long been suppressed to be unraveled to the Filipino people since time immemorial. This mysterious side had always been depicted as the darkest and people in control of information, breeds a notion that it's a damnation to have knowledge about this side. In fact, Philippine history books instill very negative pictures about a past President, while numerous living grandparents and ordinary folks who were witnesses of his reign (including my father, uncles and aunts) were all praises and admiration, calling him the "Best Philippine President ever" were undocumented.

This movie stirs additional curiosity to every Filipino as the story revolves from the point-of-view of the first family, being revealed and heard of for the first time.

A very family-oriented and brilliant movie you shouldn't miss!

As we are intelligent beings, it is but normal to be flipping both sides of the coin. It is a man's liberation and a test of humanity to have knowledge in all sides then decide his subjective judgment which side to believe in.

Title: Trash. Not realistic. Exaggerated. pathetic
Review Text:
This movie contains scenes that did not happen in reality.

Some scenes that were not true to life events:

* The Filipino people who climb in the gate carrying a torch with fire were not true. They were not aggressive and there is a PROOF of images.

* One author of the article recently said that the MIM team misunderstand the context of her article about cory playing mahjong. So basically they lack comprehension.

THE POINT OF MY REVIEW IS THAT THIS MOVIE IS TRASH. IT WASTED MY TIME AND MONEY. There were scenes where they exaggerate to make it look like the dictator's family was also victims.

Title: Would rate this lower than one star if possible
Review Text:
The only saving grace was that the ticket was free.

The writers did a poor job with their research, this much is apparent. Painfully obvious how the narrative tried to bend reality. Hence the cringe script.

Acting was subpar, it felt awkward. The actors were misguided, perhaps in their direction on how to attack such scenes. At some points, scenes felt surreal. Good thing there were some funny tidbits.

Scenes were oftentimes monotonous, yet sometimes overbearing at the same time. The shrill zany acting in the second half of the film is just irritating at best.

This film has painted a negative narrative for President Cory Aquino. According to this film, during the EDSA Revolution in 1986, the late president dared to gamble with nuns whilst the Philippines' democracy is under siege.

On the other hand, the thesis of this film was to depict the Marcoses in a better light. However, the appeal to pity was unsuccessful.

Title: This is one of the most Controversial and Important films in Philippine History.
Review Text:

It finally showed what was happening inside Malacañang during those times. In the film you could actually connect some parts of it to Philippine history and would make absolute sense.

Also, if you watched the film you would know that it never distorted history instead it filled those gaps in history. Director Darryl Yap, who is also the screenwriter of the film, did an excellent job with this film that it really made Philippine Cinema returned.

Title: NO HISTORICAL REVISIONISM
Review Text:
I attended a special screening organized by the 31 Million Movement from Facebook last August 5th held at Greenbelt 3 in Makati. Even it's too far from my house, I rode an Angkas taxi even with torrential rain since I was so late and got all wet, because I know that it will be all worth it. And it did. No disappointments nor any dissatisfaction. I even met Billy Jake Cortez and Julinana Parizcova Segovia, special guests for this screening.

The movie itself was good. The actors who portrayed every character has their own distinction, and were of high caliber. No historical revisionism was made nor inteded on this movie as the others were telling. They just told the untold stories of the Marcoses during their last 72 hours in The Malacañan Palace.

Congratulations to Direk Darryl Yap for yet another masterpiece and can't wait for the rest of the Trilogy to be released.

Title: Don't mind the 1star reviews
Review Text:
First of all, don't even waste your time reading all the 1-star reviews that were given to this movie. They are just mad because they are driven by the fear that their narratives might be overshadowed.

Second of all, this is just a FAMILY drama and intended to show their side of the story that other people outside the President's residence are not aware of.

Plot: This is just a straightforward dramedy that tells the struggles of the first family of the Philippines during their last 72 hours inside the Malacañang palace. The movie is divided by chapters. Of course it touched politics, but more than that it was a Family drama. The story was told with a mix of truth and artistic view. The movie will make you cry and laugh at the same time.

Tone: It was made to entertain and educate as well. It highlights what is obvious in Politics; trust, betrayal, loyalty, etc. Most importantly, it really tackles the importance of family during difficult times.

Acting and Characters: All the actors have played their roles really well. It seems that each character's attitude and behavior fit the actor who played it. Every scene is remarkable and will pinch your heart as if you are part of the scene. You can feel the emotions in every dialogue exchange, as if they are not acting and just comes out naturally.

Cinematography: There were scenes where the camera is panning in circular motion as if the movie is showing the audience how this family's life is turning upside down especially the scene between the mother and her son. The movement and acting are aligned and the actors are properly framed.

Summary: This may be my own opinion about the movie, but I can assure you that this is a legit review as I have already watched the entire film. Don't rely on the reviews having 5 stars and below, there are some Anti Marcos out there that don't even bother to watch the whole movie yet they are leaving reviews as if they are being good critics when in fact they are just bitter because another Marcos has returned in Malacañang. 🙂

Title: Historical Revisionism
Review Text: This family is a fvcking liar, my grandma and grandpa are both victims of this regime and no remorse or apology has been given to them and all the other 11,000+ people who died and went missing because of their evilness. Title: Disappointed
Review Text:

Not just that. The acting, cinematography and overall performance of the crew and writing of script is very boring.

Title: Title doesn't fit with the supposed narrative
Review Text:
I expected to see what was just happening with the family 72 hours before they got exiled. Like a documentary of sorts, what they did, how much they were forced to leave behind

"Huling tatlong araw ng mga Marcos sa Malacañang, ano ang nangyari?" was the supposed plot

Yet, the movie didn't give the experience of a family in their last 72 hours

The progression of events is anti-climactic

The flow of conversation is hollow

The choice of words contribute to the hollowness

The storytelling is disorderly

Continuously changes format narratives

I think if they stuck to a "documentary" type of movie it would've fit well

They didn't know what to tell and how to tell it, so it became an amalgamation of every movie format possible

They just combined all their scenes by inserting "chapters" and "long texts" in between that literally summarizes what they want to tell-which defeats the purpose of a movie

Cristine Reyes carried the movie, Ella Cruz has solid crying acts

Cesar Montano, playing the infamous dictator, has no semblance of the supposed 'strongman' traits of the one he's playing Diego Loyzaga literally has no emotion

Others didn't do anything Looking at you Kiko Estrada

Misrepresentation of nuns with Giselle Sanchez playing mahjong already crosses this film out as a supposed "addition" to history, since said nuns are cloistered

Usage of words that were not present those days, but are yet frequently heard in the movie

Usage of musical scores are way off, since most of the scores play in scenes that are unremarkable

Then by the end, there's a weird and sudden tribute to characters that were not given its decent exposure during the actual movie runtime. An illusion that something is made for them - yet the movie is portraying a supposed tribute for the said dynasty

In the end, you'd stay awake because it isn't boring, but you're trying to understand why the movie is made as it is, and the supposed plot and the actual output strayed so far

#MaidInMalacañang.

Title: I wanna give it a 0, but that's not possible - so a 1.

Anyway. One word: TRASH.

Title: MIM- Love and Loyalty
Review Text: MIM is an interesting movie to watch... Its not about revisionism nor against someone. For me its all about love and loyalty to ones family... I love the loyalty of the workers who stayed with family esp the 3 maids. It moved me when they tore IRM's gown to protect themselves and when Imee picked up the Phil flag. Ella's is excellent and so with Kristine. Kudos to Direk Daryl for this kind of art. Keep it up direk and soar high. I highly recommend this movie.

Title: An obvious but weak attempt at REVISING Philippine history
Review Text: Maid in Malacañang is a recent film touted as the story told by an unknown and unverified source (the "maid") of the last 72 hours of the Marcos' family inside Malacañang Palace, the official residence of the Philippine president and his family. What makes the movie historically false is that there are scenes featuring Corazon Aquino, then the main opposition presidential candidate. How was the source or the "maid" able to tell what was happening to Mrs. Aquino when she was about 900 kilometers away at that time? When a movie shows historical falsehood it can only be considered as a fantasy/fictional movie and should never be taken seriously. If you want to waste time, money, and effort, then do watch this film.

Title: A Low Budget Movie that will Keep you On your Toes
Review Text: Amidst criticisms from anti-Marcos groups and calls for its ban from the Cory Aquino followers, this movie brought a fresh take on the last 72 hours of of the Marcoses in Malacanang in 1986. For Marcos loyalists, their belief on the former first family has been cemented. I hope to see more movies that depict the truth!

Title: Waste of time and resources
Review Text:
They forced us to watch this movie, given us free tickets and a salary bonus worth a day of work. All of that trouble but still ain't worth every minutes we spent. Now they're requiring us to do a review and give this 10 contrary to our conscience. So I'll take this opportunity to show my frustration instead.

I promised to myself that I won't participate in this political quarrel, but after watching this and sharing a room with some of their worshippers, I can now understand why they received so much hate. This is so bad that the comfortable sit in cinema feels like a iron chair (the one they use for torture). The whole environment itself is bad, not just the movie. I can't explain it, but everyone feels dead. Like if this is hell, then it's actually worse than what they portray in every story. And for a "supposedly" historical movie, this is very cringey. If I were to choose whether the world hunger to be solved or unwatch this movie, I would definitely choose the latter without any hesitation.

So this is my suggestion to all of those people who hate this movie too, it is easier to unalive the director than to live a life full of hatred that was caused by him.

Title: Best Marcos Film
Review Text: Marcos has been portrayed as a tyrant for decades by the communist and power grabber in the Philippines. This movie portrays the true picture of Marcos family and how they were deposed violently by the rebellious people. It clarified that the people power revolution became peaceful because Marcos ordered to do so. The so-called revolution was actually a coup d' etat of the high ranking military traitors with human shield. Cory Aquino was not a symbol of democracy. She got her position not through a democratic election, but through power grabbing. Hence, this film stirs a lot of emotions. I feel sorry for the Filipinoes who suffered decades of hard life because of deposition of a great president.

Title: Garbage!!
Review Text: This film divides more the Filipino people as it is an attempt to historical distortion and revisionism. Title: Historical distortion

Title: PROMOTES HISTORICAL DISTORTION
Review Text:

A good movie doesn't only mean good cinematography, after all that's the reason why Film is a degree program, it requires research amd accountability on how people should perceive the theme.

Movies or even TV Series (e.g. Snowdrop) like this in different countries are criticized because IT IS A THREAT TO HISTORICAL FACTS.

Title: inaccurate
Review Text:
Story is confusing. It is supposed to be based on real life events. However, some scenes are very inaccurate and did not happen in real life.

For example, the scene with Cory is not true. The article used as evidence was wrongly comprehended. In making historical or real life movies, evidences and thorough research is needed because 1 wrong info may lead to confusion or change in the real experiences of the characters.

Title: Majority if not all Negative reviews here are from the losing party last election with the line " let me educate you".
Review Text:
Movie is good... It gives us a chance to see the other side of the coin in a widely monopolized story in the history of Philippines and it's politics... Its a window to peep in inside the seat of power in the country using the eyes of those people who were actually there to see it and not from the lens of others who have tried to suppress the flipping of the coin.

You will appreciate the storyline, the portrayals and all if you go and watch with neutral stance on matters concerning Philippine politics..but of course, not easy to do for a person like , being an ilocano descent with over 20 years of exposure to the monopolized truth taught in schools from elementary to college pair it with a conflicting view and accounts from elders who have actually lived throughout the heavily pixelized Marcos and Aquino Eras.. Again, the reason why we paid individual tickets to o enter the movie house is because we watch every movie as it is and perceive it individually, so , it is for us to judge and discern and not let others grow and sow their own personal biases inside of us... Going back to the movie Itself, in all fairness, It did not imply to discredit what the other story line has been depicting all these years, it was just there to tell its own story....so I don't know where the hate is coming from , maybe, they'll just afraid to see that there is really another angle equally important to look at and consider aside from their get go and comfortable, well written, published and universally true side... Bottom line is, when it tingles a little bit in your spine and you somehow have the means to watch it, go... And tell yourself what you think... Don't let them be the judge for you...enjoy the movie , and if in some way you have spare, then go watch the other movie too...

Title: 1 star rates are fake and they did not watch the movie at all, yellowtard please move on from the last election.
Review Text:
The MIM is not a documentary movie. It is neither a historical biopic nor a political film.

It is not about martial law. It is the untold story about Edsa Uno.

It is a drama movie... a story of an aspect of the fall of the powerful Filipino family. The fall of the Marcoses did not just happen in Edsa Uno; it started when President Marcos decided to stay in power for life and culminated in February 25, 1986.

It is not intended to alter the dominant Edsa People Power narrative. But it provides us a glimpse of what happened in the other side of Edsa, the Malacanang Palace.

It is not historical revisionism as alleged by the sanctimonious among us who appointed themselves as protectors of our history.

After watching the movie, I wonder why the yellows (rebranded as Pinks; a masked people or balatkayo) and the anti-Marcos people are making much political noise about the movie.

It is a story about what happened to the Marcos during the last days in power.

Title: A failed attempt for Public Sympathy
Review Text:
I am personally confused as to why this was titled 'Maid in Malacañang'. But anyways, this movie wasn't as confrontational as rumored to be or portrayed in social media. Except during that scene with Giselle Sanchez playing as Cory Aquino. This film showed a different side of the story where we see that the Marcoses weren't as cold-blooded as they were made out to be by historical literature and documentation.

To cut the review short without leaving any spoilers, MIM is a self-serving movie only towards the Marcoses and their loyal supporters. The acting and research behind this movie were hit-or-miss too; Ruffa Gutierrez fails to embody the delusion of grandeur that Imelda Marcos had.

P. S. Where's the infamous DIAMONDS IN DIAPERS?

Title: Jarring, Overdramatized, and Malicious
Review Text:
Where do I start? The direction of the movie's flow villainizes historical figures who were against an internationally-known dictator in Philippine history. Why redeem real, living, breathing people for theft, graft, and power-hungry ego? Also, the daughter of the dictator bought most of the tickets to give away for free so people would come to the premiere but only a few did.

Moving on from the "political statement" this movie so badly wants to make into reality, the actors did do a decent job at acting but the editing and pacing can leave a lot to be desired. It rides on the controversy and trend of being pro-dictator ? The direction is cheesy and stereotypical.

Title: A film about a powerful political family facing the reality of their collapse.
Review Text:
The film portrayed the last three days leading to the fall of the Marcos family and their exile to Hawaii in 1986.

Taking away the political bias, the context of the film was about how each family member responded and acted to the realization that their world, their paradigm, was about to shatter because of betrayal which is a universal theme that everyone can relate to.

The cinematography was good, limited by the fact that the film had a meager budget and there was only one or two shooting locations for the movie. The soundtrack was well-thought of and laid out very well throughout the movie. Editing was better than most Filipino films that I personally had seen.

The acting was top-notch, and this is coming from a non-viewer of Filipino films---the performances were riveting and heart-wrenching which took me by surprise and disarmed me which is probably because so many people had given the movie bad reviews based on the trailer and not actually watching it. There were scenes which were jarring to paranoia tempered by scenes that were light-hearted and cringingly humorous. My only wish was that the costumes, props, and settings were more historically accurate, but I will cut it some slack since there wasn't much of a budget to begin with.

I would gladly recommend this movie to everybody, and would like to encourage everyone to have an open mind and the suspension of disbelief when going in the movie theatre. One's politics is only a small fraction of one's personality, so leave it at the doorstep and enjoy a rollercoaster ride.

This movie is a good one to take the time to watch. It is a film that is greater than the sum of its parts. Looking forward to watching the proposed sequels.

Title: Historical distortionism
Review Text:
The movie claims to tell history from the perspective of the dictator's family. But at the cost of the truth. Martial law was a very dark age in the country's history. The family being portrayed as the "victims" in the movie is the same family that is responsible for the death and torture of thousands of Filipino people. This in addition to the billions of wealth that they stole from the people.

Hiding behind this "movie" is the intent to change history in favor of the aggressors.

The people may forget but history does not.

Their is only one history and that is the history written in the blood and sweat of those that fought for the freedom and rights of the people.

#neveragain.

Title: Absolute Garbage
Review Text:
The sole purpose of this production is to delude the mass into accepting a side of the Marcoses that never existed. Whether you're part of the opposition or not, this is an extremely evil tactic to paint a good picture of a family whose history revolves around antagonizing our countrymen. The very existence of this film and its supporters spit on the lives and suffering of those who were unfortunate enough to dwell under thetyranny of the Marcoses' rule.

Darryl Yap is hardly a respectable director. His research team failed twice during the making of this film - what makes you think this is any worth watching? Drop it; look for better sources to view this side of Philippine history with. In a time where ignorance and defilement have infested our country's media, we must remember to always say NO to historical revisionism!

Title: History Revised!
Review Text: This is purely fictional. The Producer is Imee Marcos so expect that the movie will revolve around her. It portrays the lavish lifestyle that the Marcos' had but them being so nationalistic and very concerned with the Filipino people was distorted in the movie. The funny thing is that the Marcos' relied on the gossips of the maids for their decision making. That in itself was already a red flag. The actual footages of the videos from the EDSA Revolution were just spliced to fit in the fictional storyline. The movie would appeal to the blind masses that are loyalists to the Marcos'. The whole events that happened in the palace were romanticized by the director like the Bongbong and Imelda drama in the bed, the father and son talk of Sr and Jr, Marcos and his daughter Irene, the speech of the 3 maids and the households,etc to make the movie palatable. As a fictional movie, it was OK but as representative of history, have more discernment when watching this.

Title: Christine Reyes is this movie's only saving grace
Review Text:
Despite the negative things I have been reading about it, I still watched to see what it for myself. But, from what I've seen, the negativity it is receiving is well-deserved.

Christine Reyes' acting was the only positive thing I saw here. She is good with her portrayal and commands attention everytime she is on screen. The rest of the actors are disappointing. The extras are even better.

The story, indeed, runs contrary to what historical records show. There was an attempt to make the film appear to be a documentary but the lack of empirical evidence/proof as basis made it lackluster. The lousy editing made it even worse. It is like watching short videos woven together. It is not cohesive. And remarkable only for being utterly disappointing.

The musical scoring is weird. The music is ok but feel displaced as some unimportant scenes were heavily scored while the others were left disserviced by a musical scoring.

The direction of Mr Yap is also lackluster. The costumes and makeup were acceptable, but not noteworthy.

Overall, I think it will be better if they just showed it for free in youtube or other platforms for it is not worth paying good money for in cinemas. If, as the critics say, it is a tool for propaganda, then make it free for viewing. Leave the cinemas for actual movies worth they money we pay for it.

Title: This aint disney channel
Review Text: Pure fiction, nothing historical, as history is based on facts which none of your film depicts. Doesn't even deserve a spot in the archives. I thought twilight was the worst film, then i get to see this.

Title: the other side of the story
Review Text:
Superb take on the story of a family who love his country and his fellow kababayan. After watching the movie, you won't feel hate on the people who betray them but now understand how low they saw their fellow kababayan by using them for their own self interest.

They just divided the country nonetheless.

Title: Basura as ever
Review Text:
Kahit ratings dito puro hakot. Anuna?

This piece of sh* = basura. Chismis.

Katips = top tier. The truth.

I would have given 0 but it is not possible so ayan, 1 na lang.

You would never change what happened in the history. Never.

Title: The Other Side of The Story GONE WRONG
Review Text:
As someone who has an open mind when it comes to politics, this film really made me see how distorted the POV of the other side. This film really aims to justify and victimized the family by making them appear too good and genuine to the point that it is not realistic anymore and is already trying hard. There's a lot of inconsistencies that I can't help but shake my head during a lot of frames.

I really can say this film is really not good in terms of artistic expression and direction. Acting-wise, most of the main actors are stiff and boring. I do not know if their script intentionally wants them to portray the roles like that or they are just terrible actors.

Overall, if you are someone trying to understand the "other sides of the story" as the people market this film, this junk is not really the best material. One word explanation: BIASED. I am aware that the supporters of this family are mad as hell for biased pieces but this movie is indeed one of those. Well, I don't wonder why they are not raging on this one since it is something that is what they want to believe. And that brings me to my last point: if you are looking for something that can make you justify your support for the family, this is the best film for you as it majorly take advantage of ad.

Title: Poor Cinematography, and Narrative
Review Text: I watched the movie. Very poor narrative, acting was subpar, typical rushed production movie and can we be clear of the genre if this is a fiction or based on a true story.

Title: Fiction
Review Text: Worst movie in Ph cinema!!! The whole story was just made up . Even basing it an an article the director did not even understand... that's so funny right? Most of the scenes did not even happen...This is not an art it's a waste of time piece of garbage!

Title: Every story has two sides, listen to them both.
Review Text: History books are not what it really is. Manipulation exist, a picture tells a thousand words but nowadays a footage tells a million words. Always know the other perspective.

Title: THIS MOVIE IS A TRASH!!!
Review Text:
THIS MOVIE IS BASED ON FAKE NEWS! IT ATTEMPTS TO REVISED THE PHILIPPINE HISTORY! FERDINAND E. MARCOS AND HIS FAMILY ARE DICTATORS AND THE MOST CORRUPT GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS IN THE ENTIRE PHILIPPINE HISTORY!

THIS IS A WORK OF EVIL! DISGUSTING! INHUMANE!

Title: Excellent movie!!
Review Text: Some people here reviewed the movie without even watching it... how funny it is....the review was posted 3 days before the movie was released in cinemas... pathetic losers...it's a movie about what the family experienced within the last 72 hours in Malacañang, no history revisions... i believe it is right and just to listen to the other side of story...

Title: trash
Review Text: Historical distortion at its finest. Blind followers and apologists would love this film no matter how tainted and fraud this is. Would never recommend.

Title: Surprisingly Good
Review Text:
I was so nervous at first that the movie might disappoint me but then I thought it was really lovely. I thought it was really funny. I thought it was really moving. You will laugh, you will cry.

Maid in malacanang is heartwarming, capably made, exceptionally well-acted, and achingly sincere without ever resorting to sentimentality.

Title: The film was boring and full of crap. Entirely a lie from start to finish.
Review Text:
Free movie stubs were given to us by some friends therefore, although I hated the thought of watching the movie, I came in to watch it with a friend. We were stuck watching the film just so we can sit on something.

First of all, don't believe these people giving this piece of crap positive reviews, these are people the director himself asked to review the movie and rate it with the highest score. The truth is, this movie was made to distort Philippine Marcos regime history. The movie clearly depicted an unlikable Cory Aquino ( Marcos' rival to the Presidential post ) to feed people with a false belief that Cory was the " antagonist" and the Marcoses we're victims of treachery and oppression of the Filipino people. The truth is, the director of this film is a friend to the Marcoses and he was paid to create a fictional version of the Marcoses story of the last 72 hours of them in Malacanang before they flee to the U. S. by force, as the Philippines had enough of their atrocities, corrupt administration and the poverty they left the country with due to their incapacity to lead the country to progress. The people had enough of them and they were attacked by the people after 2 decades under Martial Law.

The movie showed a Cory Aquino playing mahjong with some nuns while the Philippines was at war with the Marcoses. I mean, Would anyone ever think of playing mahjong while their lives are in danger and their country's state is uncertain? I don't think anybody will have the nerve to even sleep peacefully at a certain point, all the more, these people depicted to be playing mahjong are nuns and the late President Cory. This movie even managed to disrespect the nuns who brought Cory Aquino to hide with them while the Marcoses were hunting her. The movie made them seem as if they were uncaring at the time of crisis. The scene was senseless, blasphemous and laughable, as if the director tries so hard to degrade the nuns and ruin the name if the late President on purpose.

It also showed the Filipinos during the late 80's in the most advance city in the Philippines, mind you, holding torches while attacking the Malacanang Palace. What kind of activists in their sound mind would rally to the Presidential palace and while holding torches and in the late years of 1980's? Really torches in the 1980's? And people from the city in that time, holding them torches? What a funny fart ignorance of a movie this is. I don't know whether to laugh at the scene or just leave lol.

Had I known it was this ridiculous, I would have given my ticket to someone else. The movie was very inaccurate, provocative and utterly a dismay, a laughable senseless depiction, or fictionalization of characters, events and the entire history at the Marcos regime. A waste of our time.

Title: I watched this but if I can give it a 0 I would
Review Text: This movie is made of lies. It's very insulting to the Filipino people who suffered during the Martial Law. It's a pathetic attempt to twist the history. The director is a p3d0. Do not support this movie.

Title: This movie has no redeeming factor
Review Text: It's a propaganda film. The plot is convoluted, makes no sense as a movie. The only way this movie can be taken is as fiction despite the Philippine govt efforts to make it seem like a factual narrative of events.

Title: History Revisionism
Review Text:
A movie funded by the most corrupt political family in the world that wants to erase the atrocities their family has caused to the Philippines. Need I say more?

This movie is a joke in its entirety.

Title: Other side of history
Review Text: Great movie that can be an eye opener to the side of the marcos family during the so called edsa revolution. What really happened to them during 72 hours before they were exiled to hawaii that suppossed to be going to ilocos norte.

Title: TRASH
Review Text: Basura. Ginawa lang nilang maganda image ng Marcos sa movie na ito. Martial Law was not just an invocation of the President's emergency powers under the 1935 Constitution-Marcos went further to assume all governing powers, excluded civilian courts, and systematically replaced the 1935 Constitution with the 1973 Constitution for his own ends. The replacement of the Constitution was done under dubious circumstances! They don't deserve their side to be heard!

Title: Artistry at its best...
Review Text: Kudos to Darryl Yap and to all the actors in this movie. Superb performance. The movie was overwhelming. It's a bout time for the other side of the story to be heard, Marcoses other side of the story was very realistic and should not be discredit. From a family that's possessed great power to a family that has been rattled and scared about their future. Brilliant mind from the director of the movie.

Title: BIASED
Review Text: A one-sided film. Not even accurate. This doesn't represent historical legitimacy and this shouldn't be taken as anything near "history". We may enjoy watching it but a half-truth is worst than a lie.

Title: GREAT MOVIE!
Review Text: What an awesome movie for the whole family!! A must watch for all Filipinos! Long live the Philippines!!! Ait showed the different side of the story. NO HISTORICAL REVISIONISM as others claimed! We love Marcos Family!!

Title: Best movie of the year for Philippine Cinema
Review Text:

I'm glad now the children can tell their side of the history.

Title: The writer and Director looks so young but amazingly good
Review Text:

Director and writer Daryl Yap made it so really well.

Listen to both side of the story, stop being one sided. Like, seriously. If you want to side with the truth, listen to both sides of the story, then weigh it out. No matter your ideals it's important to be open minded. If you can't hear the whole other side of the story then you are the problem. It's okay to have disagreements and be open minded doesn't necessarily mean that you agree with everything new in this world. It goes both ways.

Review Text: MIM is not a historical distortion or revisionism but it helps us understand our history..History must not be one sided story. Those who rate 1⭐ and said it's distortion and revisionism are those who only watch the trailer but not the full movie and are close minded and can not accept that the person that they looked up as a SYMBOL OF DEMOCRACY is fraud person that hides in a hero's cloak..

Title: Great Movie!
Review Text:
Haters only hate the things they can't have and the people they can't have.

This film makes me believe again that Karma really exists. Karma isn't as easy to understand cause it's the universe's way of paying back. When your real intention is to give pure kind and love to others, sooner the universe blesses you/them for their good deeds. And it show now! The universe does keep track of the all the deeds and pays back accordingly, this movie is not a revisionism at all like what minority noise people are saying. There is always two sides to every story ever told, Filipino people have been taught to only observe and understand one side of every story and that is to hate Marcos. But only observing one side of a story blocks our way of perceiving a event or action taken. Its essential to have more than one perspective on a topic to get a clear educated opinion. Great cast and I love the movie!

Title: It's a Vincentiments Film
Review Text:
The main characters "yaya santa" told their stories the way you had to tell it inside a household, it's like sitting in your aunt's or friends home and get to listen to their daily conversations, arguments, and even banter and i think it was made that way. I had a tinge of sadness for what happened to the household workers, they werent given a choice and they werent really part of you know whats happening outside. I had to give it to Cristine and Cesar, they are really great actors. For actually a simple film, their acting is still consistent from all their award winning movies. Ruffa's transformation to IRM is on point. I was hoping though she could've given more lines or scenes. But nonetheless, the film is not that bad. The dark comedy, the punch lines, and the way the film was made were all done in Vincentiments way.

Still worth php280 of my time to be honest. 🙂

Title: Funny that 1 star-reviews are from those who didn't actually watch the film. Pathetic!
Review Text: I was disappointed. I was disappointed that there was no "historical revisionism" in the movie, just like what is exploding now in social media saying the film is trying to revise history. The film only revolves around the story of the Marcos family, the people, and what is happening inside the Malacañang during the 1986 People Power Revolution. The actors were great! Christine Reyes was so damn awesome actress! Surely, the movie proved that Imee is a badass. Hahaha I was surprised that Ella Cruz's acting was great, too! The dramatic scenes can be heavy, so I suggest you bring tissue or hanky. I was preventing myself to wipe my tears at first, but when I saw other people sobbing unashamedly, I didn't stop myself. LOL I love that Director Darryl Yap added some comedy scenes to the film as a breather for the heavy drama. I enjoyed the film and I think it was also appreciated by the people who watched it, because the cinema in SM Aura where we were in exploded in applause after the film ended. I even heard people say, "Ang galing!" "Shocks, ang ganda." while clapping their hands. Awesome movie! Watch it, and leave a review only after you did so. ;)

Title: Great
Review Text:
The movie MIM is one the films I was curious about. Since it was shot in the 1980s, it gives one a nostalgic effect on the setting and the clothes worn of the actors.

Story wise, this is an account of a maid in malacanang who was never given due wages and recognition (only those who saw the movie can relate to this). It was a moving story of a struggle of the nation's leader yet his vulnerability towards his family.

Imelda Marcos played by Ruffa Gutierrez did not have that much dialogue but portrayed brilliantly with her looks and affection as a mother for her children and the country.

The transition between scenes was fluid. The satirical nature of the director cannot be denied hence, those who have been against this movie would be triggered.

Flat tops or curly tops? White rabbit.

Title: The movie that brought Filipinos back to the Cinema. A heartwrenching, untold story of the Marcos family in their last 72 hours of power.
Review Text:
Unfortunately, some reviews of this movie is politicized and given negative reviews by the Marcos haters even before it is shown in cinemas. The movie only started showing in Philippine cinema on August 3rd and it was a blockbuster hit. Tickets were already sold out by August 2, and cinemas had to add another cinema house and slot for people who walked in to watch.

Some reviews are based on their emotions and not about the movie.

Judging by the art of the film, it was made with brilliance. The timing, the plot, the story, even with a lot of conversations was not boring, it was intense and really impacting.

Maid in Malacanang is a heartwrenching untold story of what the Marcos family went through, days before Cory took office.. it's actually more of a drama and comedy film.

No scenes nor script in the film, of the Marcos family bad mouthing the Aquinos.

The plot conveyed unknown details of events but it is left to the viewers how to judge such information given.

It may be more of a personal family story rather than historical, but it will give us a lesson we never knew we were missing.

To me, the film is an opportunity for us Filipinos.

10/10.

Title: It is an eye opener to those who are bias and selective in Filipino History
Review Text:
Just watch the movie first and make your comment afterwards. This movie is not an attempt to revise history of the philippines but an attempt suply stories that has been deprived to be heard more than 3 decades ago. It is good to know the the totality of the history before drawing a particular judgment. It is illogical to directly discredit a particular experience of history just because such experience is not popular or not in congruent to what has been accepted. History is not an exclusive per se but an all-inclusive collection of recollected events in the past which undergoes series of scrutiny and validation in consideration of its truthful product. Thus, I think it is time now to listen to the other side of the story first before making your conclusion.

If you are not a Filipino be informed first before drawing your conclusion. Do not be fed with bias media instead go to the Philippines and make your further research. It sounds plausible when you listen to both sides of the story before you make any judgment about Martial Law or the Marcoses.

Title: A Movie Worth Watching
Review Text:

Title: SINO BA SILA?
Review Text:
It is not my habit to watch films on the first day they're shown in theaters. Knowing "Maid in Malacañang" is viral, popular, and controversial, I knew the cinemas would be packed so I did not make it an exception.

I watched it on the second day yet the theater was still full.

This movie is about a family that Filipinos are used to see on TV and read in newspapers and magazines, but never seen and heard behind closed doors.

This is the first time to see the candid side of the Marcoses and how they dealt with one of the most tumultuous parts of their regime.

The first part had the "Nosi Balasi" playing in the background, which made me think of the critics and the detractors that continue to discredit the Marcoses and their supporters through the years.

When you read the lyrics of this song, you'll realize that's exactly how the Marcoses treated their critics in the last 36 years.

I knew this film only presents one of the many perspectives of the so-called People Power Revolution in 1986. As the movie progressed, however, it became evident that two main perspectives are being narrated: those of the "maids" or the kasambahays, and that of the other "maid" in Malacanang who promised her father to tell their story in due time: Imee Marcos.

Others may disagree with me on this but I see this film more as Imee's perspective of events as the "panganay" and as the unpaid "maid" in Malacanang, who did her best to give order to chaos and make some of the important decisions for her family during the last 72 hours of her father's regime.

Having watched so many of Imee's vlogs and interviews, I can only imagine what she was like behind closed doors. It was Christine Reyes' portrayal of the character that gives glimpses of Imee's younger self in a way that I believed she was Imee. Christine showed Imee's facets convincingly: she was feisty, a quick thinker, always on her toes, decisive, a multi-tasker, and at times appeared to be a control freak.

The stories of the helpers inside the palace gave me a roller coaster of emotions; but more importantly, they gave the audience an idea of how the Marcoses treated their workers. The fact that the maids could be candid around the president, the first lady, and their children speaks volumes.

They also had accounts that painted the Marcoses as "just like other good employers".

One important bit that got me was when the maids showed their furs given by Imelda. The former First Lady told them that they, too, deserved to own furs. This reminded me of what FEM and Imelda often talk about in their writings and interviews: to give dignity to the Filipino people.

Of course, I couldn't help but mentally "fact-check" and compare some information in the movie with what I read from books and other publications throughout the campaign period.

The part about mainstream media spreading fake news that the Marcoses had already left Malacanang when they were still in the palace can be found in Paul Goldstein's article in EIR Journal dated July 25, 1986.

There was also the bit about Cory winning the elections based on NAMFREL's tally and FEM winning based on COMELEC's tally. You can find this info in Cecilio Arillo's book, A Country Imperiled and Rigoberto Tiglao's book, Debunked.

The part where the people at EDSA headed to Radio Veritas can be found in Paul Goldstein's article in EIR dated July 15, 1986

There's also something I noticed that's unique in this film that I don't see often in other Filipino films: the art of long takes.

A "long take" is a shot that's intended to appear as a single, uninterrupted take in the final edit of a film.

I thought this was interesting as it made the scenes appear more intimate. Long takes can draw you closer to the scene. At times, I felt transported into the story as if I were there in the moment with the characters, but as a silent and invisible observer.

As the camera gracefully glided from one angle to another, the drama and tension became more palpable. That's because long takes mimic the real-life scenarios of freely moving through space and time while expressing feelings of agony, confusion, and fear.

I jokingly posted yesterday on Facebook: "Who wrote the screenplay, Direk? Because it was attempting to make me cry."

And I did cry an ugly cry. Darryl, you're a brilliant writer. I felt the suffering, the confusion, the hopelessness, and the shattering of the souls of the characters.

The simplest of lines can turn those who are hardened into misty-eyed. You will identify something very personal in your own life with a line, a scene, a character, or a moment in this movie. I am not sure anyone could have written the screenplay any better as you did.

Another thing that I liked about this film is there were almost no actions and no special effects -- just a family and their staff talking to one another sometimes in a group, sometimes just between two people or among the family members. It's the simplicity of it that highlights its sentimental edge with dialogues so movingly performed.

You'll probably never find the stories of these characters in any publications mainly because they chose to remain quiet for decades or maybe they were not given the chance to air their side.

While others will most likely question the accuracy of the narratives in this film, no one should invalidate them especially when these perspectives come from characters who LIVED inside Malacanang for several years.

Like I said several times in my previous posts, there are hundreds or even thousands of ways to narrate an event depending on who is telling it.

Maid in Malacañang is about the perspectives of those inside the palace at the time when the opposition and the people on EDSA also crafted their own stories to tell.

All perspectives are valid, especially of those who were in the same rooms as the president of the Republic These perspectives are pieces that help complete a puzzle that perplexed the nation for decades.

The movie did not negate exiting perspectives at all. In fact, perspectives should be looked at and treated separately without prejudice against one another. This is how we understand both sides objectively. This is how we form a more complete picture of an important event in our history.

Maid in Malacañang is about how it makes you feel in the end. This movie makes me feel hopeful as a Filipino because, perhaps, this can help pave the way to national reconciliation so we can finally move on together as one.

Title: We are entitled to know the TRUTH!

Title: You can still enjoy itneben if you're anti
Review Text: No revisionism happened tbh. It tackled what was happening for the last 72 hrs inside palace while history was making it's way outside. Yes there are quite a few political POV from their side but that's just a small part of the story since it clearly is a family film. Madadala ka talaga sa actingan nila. By the end of the film you will realize that the Family isn't really a family of pure evil as the yellow/pink cult would want you to believe. They are just as human as we are. Ah oo nga pala they also treated their maids as family. You can take it with a grain of salt but tbh it's not that hard to imagine to be true ksi hanggang ngaun iniinvite pa rn nila ung katulong nila.

Title: GREAT MOVIE, IT'S HIGH FOR THE MARCOS'S SIDE
Review Text:
From CockyRocky (Facebook page Cocky Rocky, please follow him for all insights)

After military and rebel forces in collusion with the USA and the Catholic Church in the Philippines stole the 1986 snap elections from the democratically elected president, the late Ferdinand E. Marcos, rioters, looters and criminals stormed Malacañang Palace. Darkness swept across the land as a Yellow dictator illegally took over the government.

This was the start of the decline of our country's fortunes. Infrastructure, culture and the arts, agriculture, technology and even education gradually deteriorated due to her government's incompetence and corruption. The departure of the Marcoses signaled the start of our national trials and tribulation.

But. History is not through with the Marcoses.

The story of our country's success, security and prosperity begins again. Two great families - powerhouses, polar opposites and legacies - have come, a son of the North and a daughter of the South. Together, they are electrifying the world with their statecraft.

What a glorious time to be alive, to be a Filipino. Philippine history is upended. The truth and lies which were deviously but masterfully mangled, marbled and warped through the passage of time are now under scrutiny. This is a reckoning. We are fighting not just for our stories today but for everyday that we have lost since the historical revision which began in 1986.

The past - hidden by the hate-filled lies of the academics, the clergy and the media - are finally seeing the Philippine sunrise for the first time. Let it not be dimmed and cowed into obscurity again.

Title: An Actual Objective Review of the Movie
Review Text:
Okay. I am writing this because I just watched it earlier.

First of all, folks, the movie is not "bad". You only deem it bad because it portrays the side of the Marcoses.

Second, Have you watched it? Have you actually bought tickets to see the film? If yes, did you watch it for entertainment? Or did you watch it as your source for "the truth". Because if you went for the latter, then you're a snowflake and you just proved the other party's point that they can trigger you. Your source of information shouldn't be on what you see on the movies. It's a movie, give everyone a break.

Third, they portrayed the side of the Marcoses. If you think your idea of their own experiences should be followed, then you go make and produce the movie.

Fourth, when did you actually see a Marcos film post 1986? You know, the one that depicts their part of the story, even if it was bad. Was there? Honest question. Because I don't think there ever was. And this was the perfect film for it. Admit it or not, post 1986 we were already bombarded with Anti-Marcos, Pro Aquino, NPA, Martial Law events and victims movies - BUT. NOT. ONE. MARCOS. FILM.

Anyway, here is my take on the movie.

First five-ish "Chapters" of the movie went on with no cut scenes. I found this amazing as it shows their mastery of their script and their character.

The build up of the story was slow but entertaining, nonetheless, thanks to the comic of the three maids.

They were obviously pointing out references to defend themselves (Marcoses) which was kind of a smirking moment for me - it wasnt because I doubt them or something but more of a "Okay they are being defensive on this part but go on."

The team tried to build up the story by "Chaptering" the whole plot which is I think is kind of in the infant stage of Philippine cinema, at least they tried, and I should give credit to them because it was in a unique way of directing/producing the film. Given the fact that our movie industry is falling apart because of the likes of mainstream tweetums drama cliche stories of Cardo Dalisay, Kim Chiu, Vice Ganda and the like.

Feels of the movie could be better. I guess it was just the filter of the picture.

There were scenes of some of news cuts. It was okay for references but again, it could be portrayed/edited better. But nevertheless, the cinematic feels is there.

The torches, the Mahjong, the nuns were better off omitted if possible. But it is their point of view so whether or not these were true, they left it for us to do more research if we wanted confirmation.

Acting: The three maids, were great especially Beverly Salviejo. Great Character!

Ella Cruz was really into it! I thought she's just one of those actresses who was just famous. But no, she can act. And she can perform really well!

Cesar Montano as always has always been a great actor. So thats just it.

Diego Loyzaga needs improvement. I can't wait for his lines to be finished.

Ruffa depicted Imelda just fine. Nothing much engagement with the film.

Finally, Christine Reyes. She went on full beast mode with this one. The acting was just overflowing but I guess that how they wanted to portray her.

Overall, come on guys. It's a film so just watch it. Be objective enough to give where proper credit is due and not just because of Historical Revisionism point of view. It gets old. Compare him to Hitler for all I care, but some of you watched Davinci Code, Hitler movies and Lucifer the TV show. I mean, come on.

P. S. Will watch Katips tomorrow and will leave a reply to that review as well.

Cheers.

Title: SUPERB!!!!! MUST WATCH!!! ❤❤❤
Review Text:
All those who gave just 1 star to this movie are desperate and obstinate losers who couldn't move on from their 'epic fail' movement last elections. Funny how they'd even spread their bitterness up to a movie review site!!!

BACK TO THE MOVIE...it was absolutely AMAZING!!!!! It's a whole ride of a roller coaster of emotions while watching this movie. You will definitely cry and laugh and get mad and feel all the raw emotions of everyone inside the Malacañang Palace during the last 72hrs of their stay.

DOES IS REVISE PHILIPPINE HISTORY??? DEFINITELY NOT. AS IN BIG BIG "NO". It doesn't change a thing about what we already know. The movie is not about showing who's right and wrong. It just showed the chaos and what was happening outside the palace and what was happening INSIDE the Malacañang at the same time. It never discredited any abuses nor any other claims. Instead, it just showed a new perspective and that is what was going on INSIDE the palace while every other thing is happening outside and in EDSA.

DOES IT MAKE PEOPLE SYMPATHIZE WITH THE MARCOSES? DOES IT MAKE PEOPLE SEE THE MARCOSES AS VICTIMS? NO. I don't think it intends to do that either. Everything depends on how every viewer takes everything in. It's an emotionally-packed movie and it just bombards you with everything. It bombards you with their "truth", their personal experiences, their emotions. It just literally gives you what these people felt and what they did during those last hours. Now, it's up for the viewers to decide whether or not they'd believe their story.

DOES IT PAINT LATE PRESIDENT CORY AQUINO IN A BAD LIGHT? NO. I don't think so. It just stated a normal reaction from a leader who thinks of Marcos Sr as her enemy. She wants him out of the country and so she did. I won't look at her like she's the bad one just because she wanted Marcos out of the Philippines.

AS FOR THE CONTROVERSIAL MAH-JONG SCENE...IT IS A METAPHOR. It just showed how politicians together with the "CHURCH" played their blocks for this EDSA Revolution. PLUS, FILIPINOS ARE NOT STUPID. Of course we know that Cory Aquino is really not playing Mahjong with her pink sisters during time of crisis. It's a given. Not just because we saw in the big screen that late pres. Cory and the nuns are playing means that they're really doing that at that time. We all know what to take as a symbolism, a metaphor and what to take literally.

IN VIEW HERE OF, ALL I CAN SAY IS...MAID IN MALACAÑANG IS A MUST WATCH!!!!! The family is crisis and all the characters are very relatable. Each of the viewers can see themselves in those characters, may it be as a father or mother or sister or brother or even as househelps who have been treated as a part of the family they've served for years. The music is powerful and very on point. The actors are all great!!! The lines are very very impactful especially the last part. No wonder why it will surely be a BLOCKBUSTER MOVIE!!! To everyone, WATCH IT!!!! IT IS ALL WORTH THE HYPE!!! VERY VERY WORTH IT!!!! KUDOS TO EVERYONE WHO MADE THIS MOVIE HAPPEN!!!

P. S CAN'T WAIT FOR PART TWO!!!!!

Title: My child's POV (History taught on their school)
Review Text: As a parent born in 1980, I want my children to have their freedom of expression and we respect it because it is their rights. We watched it on the first day of the movie (Aug 3, 2022) so that we can experience the vibe of millions of Filipinos who are hunger for entertainment and excited to go out with their families after 2 years of fear, anxiety brought by pandemic. The movie MiM is a very family oriented movie, that's why it has a rating of PG. And we can assure that it is very understandable and remarkable in the minds of our little ones. Me and my husband together with my youngest (15yr old), really enjoyed our family time - we laugh, react and even hide our little tears while watching the movie. It really touched our hearts as a FATHER to his SON, a SON to his FATHER & MOTHER, a DAUGHTER to her FATHER, and an AMO to their KASAMBAHAYS, we don't even thought of any political motives and it doesn't enter our minds that it was a black propaganda againts the previous administrations after the Marcos regime. I am not a movie expert, but I have eyes to see what is beautiful or not, I have hands that can feel the hands of my child that touched me during scenes that might get her nervous or excited. And I have a heart that can feel the hurt, the fear, and the hopelessness of a family that was betrayed by their so-called friends, allies, supporters and even families. I can relate to that, because I even experienced that in real life. When we got home, I asked my child "so anak may nabago ba sa history nyo?" She said "wala naman po mommy". And that's from my child's point of view. And that's their freedom! Congrats to the writer and director Darryl Yap.

A must watch! It also has rewatch value. I can see myself watching this movie over and over again.

On the other hand, please be aware that most reviews across different websites that has low rating for Maid in Malacañang, esp the earliest ones (when the movie wasn't yet released), are from yellow propagandists. They are the number 1 destabilizer of the government. They are terr0r!$ts, even in online platform (they basically infiltrated twitter in our country). Their main goal is for the world to view Philippines as a lowly country just because their presidential bet/puppet did not won. They want the Filipinos to remain ignorant so they can stay in power. Most of them are PAID TROLLS so don't take them seriously.

Title: I got teary eyed in this movie.Finally the other side of the inside story
Review Text: Congratulations to the staff and crew of Maid in Malacanang! A great movie indeed. Sen. Imee you're really a certified genius girl. Please watch it first before you reviewed the movie not because you hate the Marcoses. Promise this is not about history revisionism :-)

Title: A lesson to all the people
Review Text: I like the movie , because of how it relates to the common people. And not to trust everyone who smiles and calls you a friend. It also shows how people will treat you as a family even though uou are not related by blood. It shows that the respect and importance you give to grateful people will be exchanged with gratitude.

Title: A Family's story
Review Text: I gave my rating after I watched the movie. Unlike the trolls who gave a bad rap days before it's showing date. I have to be honest, I'm expecting the "Historical Revisionism" that the trolls are crying for. THERE'S NONE. The movie tells about the Marcos Family's last 72 days in Malacañang. Of course, adding the Cinematic and Creative mind of Daryl Yap. The MiM gives the Filipino movies a new standard.

Title: THE BEST
Review Text:
MAID IN MALACANANG

TO BE CLEAR: Yes I have my own political views and those close to me knows that. BUT, I have and will always respect people even if they have a diff political view with me. Same with their CHOICE of religion, tradition, taste in food, culture etc. THIS MAY have a few politically affected opinion. BUT, it will be MINIMAL AND NOT BIASED SO PLEASE be of the same mindset before reading. IF YOU CANNOT do so, then PLEASE DO NOT READ AND SCROLL DOWN.

This will be about the movie and not what it MAY stand for. OK? Agree? :D

__________

Admittedly, I have a love hate relationship with Darryl Yap's movies. Don't like Pornstar 2, Babaeng Walang Pakiramdam, Revirginized. Indifferent to Gluta, liked Pornstar, liked Jowable alot and truly AMAZED at Tililing. (All of which we have posts of as well) Had high hopes with this one but I really didn't know what to expect.

The story telling part was very well done. Same with the choice of music and scoring. Could have been so flat and boring because it was mostly talking among a few, emphasis on a few characters on a single location with a single topic. BUT, Biday, took control of this movie! There were a lot of powerful scenes and her involvement in those scenes, though actually minor and irrelevant and some made just to lighten the mood was SO ON POINT and FUNNY it made this movie that much more fun to watch! Truly unexpected and caught me off guard that made me laugh so hard.

The cast in general were really good, special mention to Christine Reyes, wow, Cesar Montano, wow, and BEVERLY SALVIEJO, WOW! Ella Cruz had one powerful great scene and hoped she did more.

8 of 10 for me. Was suppose to be a 9 but that cheap shot in the end was distasteful and merits a minus one, even if the telephone conversation (alone) was based on a documented interview. BUT, overall, something worth watching, specially because of Biday :D #wherecollectingisalifestyle.

Title: Heart wrenching
Review Text: Salute to all the character of Maid in Malacañang you did a great job. From the trailer to premier you nailed it. It's so tear jerking Movie.i love it!!! Please watch to your heart content and don't forget to bring your tissue with you.

Title: THE BEST MOVIE OF THE YEAR
Review Text:
I watched the movie here in Singapore. Nakakatawa! Manang Biday nailed it!

Nakakaiyak! Those scenes with Cesar, Christine & Ella.

And I'm so proud of the Marcos family. All their helpers in Malacañang were treated with kindness and respect.

Congrats Daryll Yap for this wonderful movie of the year.

Title: Full of Emotions and Superb Soundtrack
Review Text: A movie that will touches your heart. The director made this film as simple understanding what is really happening inside the 72 hrs of Marcoses lives. Good cinematography and the actors and actress are amazing! Worthy of your time and money to watch.

Title: Genius Darryl Yap!
Review Text: Those who rated 1 were bitter and loser kakampwets who didn't even watch the movie but so eager to bring this movie down just because it's not in favor with their yellow/pink narratives. I'm not a troll and we paid for our tickets. I cried 3-4 times and laugh a lot of times.

Title: GREAT MOVIE!!10/10
Review Text:
The movie was not about revisionism as what others who have not watch the movie claimed. I understand if others rate it as 1 even before the movie was released on cinemas maybe due to political reason I think. The movie was about the Marcos family during their last 72 hours in the malacañang. The cinematography was good. Kung di magaling ang pagawa, the movie can be boring. From start to end sobrang ganda. So far, this is the only philippine movie na aking napanood na aking pinalakpakan..GOOD JOB! Maid in Malacañang!

We did a good decision to reserved tickets 3 days before the movie shown in cinemas kasi laging sold out.

Title: A MUST SEE MOVIE!!!
Review Text: This movie will surely give you lots of emotions. Scenes will make you laugh, cry, get mad, get scared, sympathize, empathize. Definitely a movie for the ages. The story centered with the Marcos family in the 80's era where they must face the difficult situations ,cirumstances and wise dwcision to save themselves and the people they loved. How they adjusted to the actions and reactions of people around them. How the characters in the story helped each other and played their individual roles . You'll be longing for a second and third part trilogy.

Title: An eye opener and a very heart warming film
Review Text: This movie made me feel so sad about what happened to their family. I never knew that before. I am happy that I watched this film. It is the only movie that made me cry multiple times. You guys should watch it. An untold story of a family that was misjudged their entire life. It shows how the Philippine history I knew before was not the real truth. You will know what I mean once you watch it.

Title: AN UNTOLD STORY OF A KNOWN FILIPINO FAMILY
Review Text:
As someone who ACTUALLY WATCHED the film, I believe, It would be better for someone like me (who have watched it) to comment or make a review about it.

The movie has A LOT going on, definitely worth your money. It is an "untold story of a known Filipino family", nowhere near how they call it: "historical revisionism", but I do agree with revising parts of our history if there is a need to, and clearly, there is.

It is well-made; the acting, the plot itself, the setting, the effects, the props/clothes, everything.

It made me cry and at the same time, it made me laugh. Now, if you'd like to feel the same thing, know the what's happening inside the Palace that time, and know the Marcoses better, watch #MAIDinMALACAÑANG.

Showing now in over 200 cinemas nationwide and SOON worldwide!

A little addition: I hope Director D. Yap could make the sequel for MiM; the Marcoses in Hawaii (1986-1991).

Title: movie of the year
Review Text: Most satisfying .. worth to watch... worth ur time and money a movie that full of emotion.. kudos to director daryll yap and all the artist involve on that movie.

Title: Great story and best films in the Philippines
Review Text: One of the best movies. All the cast and director are amazing. From Drama and Comedy 10/10. The cast they are both did an absolutely awesome job and fit in very well with their roles, and the directors picked their entire cast very wisely. The song was the perfect fit for the movie, and got stuck in my head after we watched it. The three maids are also awsome.

Great movie! This movie deserves to be showed worldwide. Cinematic and story line is great! Good story background.

A film to watch. Finally knowing some parts of the other side of the story.

Congratulations to the brave director, casts, and production crew for this wonderful movie.

Review Text: Okay guys this is my honest and genuine review!!!!! At first I'm not really into politics, but I get curious on what really happen during the last 3 days of Marcoses family in Malacañang. And I must say I don't like the movie but I LOOOOOOVVVEEEE IT!!!!! YES GUYS! I LOVE LOVE LOVE THE MOVIE!!! I don't want to spoil but believe me this is a must watch movie. See it for yourself and you also will be amaze! You will cry (100% BELIEVE ME YOU'LL GONNA CRY) you will laugh, you will get angry and you'll experience all other emotions when you watch this!!!!
