Title: The untold story. MUST WATCH.
Review Text: This is the other side of the story from the Marcos's perspective. If you are interested in the Philippines politics then watch this. Very moving. The cinematography is great!

Title: This one is a must watch
Review Text:
I really liked this movie, it is a refreshing take on what has always been a one sided interpretation of an important event in the Philippines.

The actors were amazing, and there was never a dull moment.

People who were always against the Family portrayed in the movie, will ofcourse hate and judge this movie without even attempting to watch it, but then again, it cannot be denied that this one is a must watch.

Again, amazing.

Title: Superb!
Review Text: A film about the Marcos family in their last 72 hours inside the Malacañang Palace. The story depicts about love for the family, helpers and countrymen....had to bring hanky and tissue coz thats what they said,it will make you laugh,cry and hate....will watch it over and over again... A true story with video clips at the of the film.

Title: It's about time!
Review Text: We were all taught the same. We've read the same books and newspaper, heard from the same media companies, seen the same side in the television and learned the same major players/characters in our history. It's about time to that we give the other side of the coin a chance to be told. This will complete the whole picture. Then, we discern.

Title: Maid in Malacanang
Review Text:
Great!!!! This is a true to life story.... The point of view of the Marcos family

President Ferdinand E. Marcos Sr. Which is by far the most great and well-loved by the Filipino people.

I highly recommend this movie.....

Title: The untold truth
Review Text: This movie literally made me cry. This movie was all about the last 72hrs of Marcoses, the other side of story and the missing piece of history. It is not a history revisionism nor a distortion. Must watch especially for the youth like me who never witnessed what actually happened during people's power, there's an actual footages that won't denied the fact! .If you have a good heart you will cry and laugh as well, but if your heart full of bitterness you will never understand the movie. Its a 10 for me! Great movie 😍

Title: Eye-Opener
Review Text:
This movie shows what is happening inside a family that's in distress.

Like any normal family, the first family here experienced different emotions as they are being attacked by the protester.

No attempt to distort history here, as some bashers and anti-Marcos would say even though they haven't watch the movie yet.

As a human beiang, the family deserved to be heard of their side of the story, about the events leading to their exile.

The casts are excellent in their respective portrayal.

Very emotional and fun at times.

Title: A great classic
Review Text: Daryll Yap is a great storyteller. The actors/actresses were effective and excellent in their assigned roles. A heartwarming story of a family in crisis. I was crying and laughing and then crying again. This movie made me love the Marcos family more. The long shots that the director used allowed the audience to be "in the scene" and to feel all the emotions as well. I watched it on the first day and will watch it again. You have to experience MAID IN MALACAÑANG yourself! Go to the cinema and experience a rollercoaster of emotions. Congratulations Direct Daryll, Viva and Sen. Imee! What a grand way to open Philippine cinema during the pandemic.

Title: P63.0 million in the first 3 days
Review Text: With a powerhouse cast and a controversial story, P63 million in ticket sales in the first 3 days is hardly surprising. If you have not seen a Filipino movie in a long while, thanks to the pandemic, this might be worth your while. Don't let the anti-Marcos critics deter you; watch and judge for yourself.

Title: A passage of history for the people to see
Review Text:
The movie shows the final moments of the Marcos family in Malacanang, showing bits and pieces of information that were fed to us but the one thing those yellow-commie aligned "historians" did not show was the human part of the people involved. The theme of family and loyalty, love for the nation is there, they really prefer to not use the gun, unlike their opposition.

If they were as "eViL" as some of these leftists/commie supporters have claimed, then how come the Philippines got worse when they elected that yellow saint of theirs who could not even bother to find out why her husband was offe'd and blamed it on Marcos senior.

History will be judged, the supposed "heroes" will be re-assessed.

"Nosi Bala Si"

Finally, at least this movie does not glorify the communists like that other loser of a movie called katips which will turn you into one of them, communist corned beef.

Title: A MOVIE THAT SPEAKS FROM THE HEART
Review Text:
I must confess that many portions of the movie found me teary-eyed. Oddly, the tears came naturally. I kept asking myself how the simple scenes could evoke such an instinctive reaction. As such, based on the tears alone, my objective star-rating for the movie should not be less than 8 stars.

My rating would have been must less than the ten stars given. But I say that the low rating of one-star from many reviewers of the movie, is grossly unfair to the artistry and quality of the film. I found no one in the cast as over-acting, most all of the cast giving sterling performances. And given me the impetus to give it my full ten-stars to increase its IMDb rating. To up the star-rating of the film.

I encourage everyone to see the film. Not only because of its message. But also because we must give the Philippines a chance to heal from the hatred that has pervaded the country for so long.

Title: MORE!
Review Text: From the words of Apo Lakay and Former Fl Imelda, "History is not yet done with me." "There is divine justice!" I am glad I get to see the Marcos' vindication after 36+ years of mud-slinging and vilification to their name! I pray that they do very well for the country so the "yellow/pink party" will NEVER be back in power.✌🏻

Title: 2022 MOVIE OF THE YEAR!!!
Review Text: This is touched my heart all the way from beginning to end! NO REVISIONS AT ALL! This depicts the treacherous AQUINO REGIME and how the got their power to the Filipino people. A must seen movie for every Filipino. Ferdinand Marcos is true hero, not only for the Filipino people; but for his family as well. Congratulations to the cast and crew.

Title: made an account just for this!
Review Text:
I should've watched this sooner.

Everything was great including the cinematography and writing. The opening gave so much nostalgia for the 80s even though I'm a Gen Z. Tons of references, props and historical videos to back it up. The comedy is very cheesy but that also applies to every Filipino movie ever.

One complaint I have is the forced dialogue and political potshots but I don't really care that much because.

1. The plot is contained in only 72 hours

2. This was made in the middle of the election where everyone was in "war mode"

FACT OR FICTION? (SPOILER)

There are some elements that are fact and fiction but the history is 100% FACT. U. S News articles back then showed the extent of the military coup where Malacañang was being peppered with rockets. The protest being violent was also true as there's no such thing as a "peaceful protest" and the movie even shows news clips of brawls between Marcos and Aquino supporters.

I saw a negative reviewer here that claimed the maids were just fictional comic relief. The same reviewer admitted that they only watched 30 minutes of the film before storming out of the cinema in anger. This is just false.

The big reveal at the end was revealing that these 3 maids were actually real people. One even sadly passed away just two weeks after the events. Almost every Malacañang staff loved the Marcoses and it's a commendable Filipino trait as maids are always treated as part of the family.

So the history is actually factual, so where's the fiction?

Opinion: Personally I feel that Imee's entire character is fiction. As she heavily contributed to this film, it feels as though this is what she wanted it to have been rather than what actually happened.

In the film, Imee is treated as the leader of the household that even her parents can depend on. But witnessing the dynamics of older Ilocano households and even in Bongbong Marcos' own words, the Parents are never questioned and they lead the family by themselves.

WHY THE RATING?

As stated, my only problems were two elements so 8/10 but overall, it was enjoyable to watch.

The solemn scenes are beautifully intermixed with the humorous scenes. It doesn't follow the Filipino extreme like making us think someone's dead only to reveal that they were sleeping. It knows when to put a joke and not interrupt the pacing.

The scenes were also heavy. Props to the actors for the performance especially during my favorite scene "Ilocos o Leyte" where Imee has a mental breakdown of paranoia after finding out the severity of the situation.

I highly encourage watching with your family (16+) as it's more of a family film than a historical film. Seeing your parents relate to the 80's references makes you feel like your bonding with them and the theme of the entire film is a lesson on how strong family bonds always prevail over petty political fights.

Title: Straight from the Fact!
Review Text:
Been watching Most of documentaries specially the Edsa event, and yes it was an unpleasant one, but what we know is just a ONE SIDED one.

Now i saw a lot, as in LOTS of supporting documents that are now binding to each other (the missing piece not shown by the media before). Also some of my titos and titas are more aware of the EDSA REVOLUTION events aside from the biased media telling me that the events are tailored.

The movie really showcase the other piece that are kept 37 years ago, specially inside the Malacañang Palace. Well documented and the actors/actress selection are excellent! Big clap for the director of this film! It was a masterpiece, indeed compare to other movies that are pure politics (self given awards) but NOT that great at all.

Title: A must-to-see-movie!
Review Text: Very unorthodox in handling both familial and political issues without compromising every element of film-making. Started to watch Yap's daring and vulgar approach in his previous movies and this is one , I would say deserves a 2-thumbs up.

Title: SOBRANG GANDA
Review Text: First time I've watch a Filipino film with excitement. Not really a fan of country's film but this movie set the bar of a good filipino film. Maybe because of the hype in social media influences me to take a look to this masterpiece. I was not disappointed. I did not expect it to be tearjerking film. It is just a family drama. You can relate to it because it is so common where when your family is in crisis, what you/charatcters in a family usually do during those time? The film portrait the Marcos is like a common family. They struggle! Kudos to the director for this art.

Title: Balanced, not political at all!!
Review Text: A family oriented movie! A must see movie. No distortion of history. Go watch and know the other side of history, the real story provided by the Marcoses. The historic last moments of Apo Marcos. Very smart, clever and harmless film by Darryl Yap. Christine Reyes, Cesar Montano, Ella Cruz, Diego Loyzaga, Ruffa Gutierrez, and the three maids, Elizabeth Oropeza, Karla Estrada and Beverly were all awesome artists. I cried, I laughed, I got upset, mad. As what the three maids in Malacañang said, the 1986 revolution was peaceful because the Marcoses didn't retaliate. The Marcoses didn't want violence, pain, and death.

Only narrow-minded people and bitter losers despise this wonderful film.

Title: The movie isn't a total rotten fruit but a lot of things need improvement!
Review Text:
Just watched Maid in Malacañang a couple of days ago. This is my first time to write a movie review and since I have no expertise in anything related to film production and writing stories, take this as a piece from an ordinary moviegoer. You might come across some strange expressions here, so I'm sorry in advance.

TECHNICAL STUFF. Whether it's the cinema's systems or the film's audio mixing, I found the sound so terrible that it affected my experience during the entire time. It was too loud that I had to cover my ears sometimes, even more for the moments when Cristine Reyes as Imee was shouting. And the balance between dialogue and music wasn't great; the Nosi Ba Lasi song didn't fit in well. And I wanted to enjoy the song naman while following the scenes. Another thing is the text. Did they make the text switch too soon or am I just a slow reader. I think it was too fast, and was part of my thought about the story feeling so rushed.

MUSIC. Nosi Ba Lasi is the theme song of the film. I didn't pay attention to the lyrics (never listened to the song before) but this version of Sampaguita's song did give some melancholic feeling to the story. Also I wished the background music wasn't so plain. I'm a sucker for movie soundtracks. The music score should have a unique identity.. It wasn't memorable. Also the sound of plucking strings during the maids' scenes felt pretentious. Didn't fit in with the sound style of the film.

CAST AND CHARACTERS. Okay, so I know nothing about the personalities of the family, so I wanted to see how the film would portray them whether it's assuming we already know the kind of people they are or it's gonna introduce them to us as if they're new (of course, accompanied with the knowledge this film is about the presidential family living at the Palace). I'm on the latter. I think Imee's introduction was good because I got to know her as this woman who's always moving, got a lot on her mind. When she gets back to the Palace, she's shown as the person most concerned about matters at home. I would be disappointed too if my siblings don't know what to do with their responsibilities haha. So I got the impression that the story would focus more on her development but the film dropped her in the middle of it. Irene, Imelda, and Bongbong suddenly got scenes of their own when I didn't really get to know them before that. (And clearly the father Ferdinand is a secondary character). Like, okay, I didn't care about their emotionals because I was already hooked on Imee's development from the start. The actors weren't bad actually. Christine Reyes as the stressed out Ate-of-the-house was impressive. Of course, she's the star here. For the other actors, I wasn't really impressed with them. I wish the story was written differently to bring out their best talent.

STORY. Bruh, I didn't enjoy the pacing. Too much tense and emotional scenes, it felt like a drag. I actually zoned out during Bongbong and Ferdinand's scene. And I saw two people on their phones during that scene too. I was expecting a good breathe of air after that but Irene's scene came next, I think. Hopefully my memory isn't bad. Also maid Biday's presence during that scene felt so out of place. I actually found it funny but it still didn't fit in appropriately. I wish the household staff had more scenes on their own since I felt they were important people in the story. If the story was written to not focus so much on the family but the Palace as a whole, I would've found it more interesting. The balance between serious and comedy needs improvement. Last thing, Robin Padilla's cameo was goddamn too cringe. What is this? The MCU? Welcome to the Malacañang-verse. And IRM 2022 during the Bongbong & Imelda scene was, er, cheesy.

THINGS I LIKED. I can't explain how the scene with Ferdinand and Imelda dancing in the middle of the Palace's chaos was nice. Ganda. Imee's scene with the staff at the end. I think that the only emotional scene I liked. The family cared for the staff and didn't simply abandon them. After Ferdinand called Imee the best maid in the Palace, the fact that the three maids were real people was a (heartwarming) twist! "Maids are not just maids."

Summary of stars deducted: 1. Terrible sound mixing and musical score was disappointing for a movie soundtrack lover 2. Lack of character exposition and development 3. Story felt like dragging and lost my interest and attention in the middle 4. Robin Padilla cringe and inappropriate comic relief (the maids deserved better!)

Title: Everything is superb!
Review Text: Since elementary, our textbooks taught us that the Marcoses were monsters and the Aquinos were the heroes. I watched the movie because I believe that it's time to hear the other side of the story, and it blew my mind. I was enlightened. Now I understand them better. I definitely recommend this movie, be prepared experience a roller coaster of emotions. Lol. The actors were exceptional, especially Christine Reyes! Hands down!!! Great casting, and amazing cinematography! Standing ovation!
